page.title: 17FOOTPATHS, ARRETON VALLEY
page.content: There are many footpaths in this area, taking the walker across the fields in the Yar Valley. The footpath from the Langbridge Church to Haseley Manor is now closed but the old railway track nearby can be used instead. The long distance Bembridge Trail in the north of this area is sited alongside the ridge of chalk downs, which extend along the length of the Island from The Needles to Culver cliff, Bembridge. This trail passes by Arreton School and takes the traveller eastwards between Langbridge and Mersley Farm. The railway line between Sandown and Shide with stations at Alverstone, Newchurch, Horringford, Merston and Blackwater was opened in 1875 and closed in 1956. Some sections of the old line are now used as footpaths.
